snippet: President Obama nominated a diverse group of judicial candidates on Wednesday as the White House tries to address concerns about the number of minorities on the federal bench.
abstract: President Obama nominates a diverse group of judicial candidates as the White House tries to address black lawmakers’ concerns about the number of minorities on the federal bench; nominates Darrin P Gayles, who would be the first openly gay black man to serve as a federal judge, Beth Bloom, Carlos Eduardo Mendoza, Paul Byron and Cheryl Ann Krause.
lead_paragraph: President Obama nominated a diverse group of judicial candidates on Wednesday as the White House tries to address concerns about the number of minorities on the federal bench.

headline.main: With Nominees, Obama Responds to Diversity Concern
headline.print_headline: With Nominees, Obama Responds to Diversity Concern
